title: Nineteenth-Century Sociographic Journalism and the Formation of Ethnographic and Sociological Knowledge
descriptions:
This grant proposal seeks funding for a project titled "Nineteenth-Century Sociographic Journalism and the Formation of Ethnographic and Sociological Knowledge". This project aims to conduct the first comprehensive study exploring the foundational role of nineteenth-century sociographic journalism in shaping social science. The project will focus on analyzing a diverse corpus of materials including social sketches, travel accounts, philanthropic reports, and caricatures from Western Europe, German-speaking countries, and Latin America.

The outcomes of this project will include a series of essays, a conference, a public exhibition, a volume publication, and two monographs. The research will employ anthropological and historiographical approaches to investigate the representational techniques of sociographic journalism, its connection with epistemic developments, its embeddedness in socio-spatial settings, and its relations to academic, artistic, and governmental projects. Additionally, the project will explore the situating of journalistic sketches against urbanization, cultural transfer, nation-building, and the institutionalization of academic disciplines.

Funding for this project will support groundbreaking research that will contribute significantly to our understanding of the origins of ethnographic and sociological knowledge in the nineteenth century.
